text: Thomas Earl Petty (October 20, 1950 â€“ October 2, 2017) was an American musician, singer-songwriter, voice actor and record producer. He is best known as the lead singer of Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers, but is also known as a member and co-founder of the late 1980s supergroup the Traveling Wilburys (under the pseudonyms of Charlie T. Wilbury, Jr. and Muddy Wilbury), and his early band Mudcrutch. Some of his popular songs include: "Wildflowers", "Running Kind", "Stop Draggin' My Heart Around", "You Don't Know How It Feels" and "You Wreck Me". Petty was also known for his voice role as Lucky in the television series King of the Hill. In his career, Petty sold more than 80 million records worldwide, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. In 2002, Petty was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame. Petty died on October 2, 2017 after he was found in his home in Santa Monica, California suffering from cardiac arrest after accidentally overdosing on prescription pain medication and fentanyl patches at the age of 66. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Drug-related accidental deaths in the United States Category:American rock guitarists Category:American bass guitarists Category:American blues musicians Category:American country guitarists Category:American country singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American voice actors Category:Singers from Florida Category:Musicians from Gainesville, Florida Category:Actors from Gainesville, Florida
